name: 18th Street Brewery
description: Hand-crafting small and big beers for NW Indiana and Chicagoland.

name: 3 Beards Beer Company
description: 3 Beards Beer Company enables undiscovered artisan brews from all over the world to be locally brewed and freshly distributed. We focus on talented individuals who have the desire, but not necessarily the means, to share their creations with other enthusiasts.

name: 3 Stars Brewing Company
description:
3 Stars Brewing is a DC based production brewery founded by Mike McGarvey and Dave Coleman to provide the community with great, fresh, local craftbeer. 

We are looking forward to opening our doors in 2011. In doing so, we will proudly brew beers that push the limits of conventional brewing while still providing our customers with great, fresh, local craft beers...contact us at info@3starsbrewing.com

name: 4th Way Brewing Company
description: Microbrewery with a cafe to feature our wide range of beer styles matched with local organic eats.

name: 50 Back Brewing Co
description:
Our entire purpose is to say "Thank you" to all of the active Troops and Veterans in our Country who have served so selflessly to protect and preserve our dear Nation and precious Freedom! Of course, our gratitude began close to our hearts with our own fathers, grand-fathers and uncles, and quickly spread to friends, neighbors, and colleagues.

We searched for a way to carry out our goal, we decided to find an avenue that would facilitate wide-spread reception and the ability to give back repeatedly. What better way than a great tasting lager? As predicted, the reception to our mission has, indeed, been overwhelmingly positive and dynamic. As we share our idea, everyone invariably expresses their gratitude for the fact that we are providing a manner in which they can give back on an individual and personal level. Surprisingly, Troops and Veterans have said "Thank you" back to us!

name: Abigale Brewing Co
description: Inspired by the hop heritage of nearby Wye and with a particular interest in the flavours of the hop varieties that have been developed at Wye in the past, Abigale Brewing Company craft their ales in the heart of Kent using the finest quality ingredients.

name: Airways Brewing Company
description:
Friendly service and tasty beer make us a favorite of locals as well as beer enthusiasts from all over. 

Special and seasonal beers make a frequent appearance. Our tap room has bar seating as well as small tables. On sunny days, garden seating is available.

Airways opened on March 4, 2010. Founder and brewer Alex Dittmar has had a lifelong passion for 60′s era jetliners. Airways is a combination of his love for airplanes, good beer, and a connection with people from all over the world.

name: American Honor Beer Company
description: Our classical revolutionary heroes including Henry, Franklin, Jefferson, and Washington set forth a paradigm to enable American prosperity and the creation of the greatest civilization in history. At American Honor Beer Company, our brews serve as a rallying point for those who cherish and commemorate America’s founding principles. General Liberty raises a toast to each and every American who honors the individual's natural rights to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.

name: American River Brewing Company
description:
NESTLED near the American River in Rancho Cordova, CA and located in a revitalized warehouse along Trade Center Drive is American River Brewing Company.

The dream-come-true of founder/brewer David Mathis and Head Brewer Andy Armstrong, American River Brewing Company encompasses the life-long passions of beer and the art/science of brewing.

Plans for the brewery began in 2010. After more than 15 years in the commercial brewing industry, we embarked on locating a useable location to house a production level brewery that would include a tasting room and space to grow. After an exhaustive search a home was found and construction began in the summer of 2011.

The original scope called for a modest 7 bbl brew house with tanks enough to manage 2000 bbl of production per year. After much re-thinking and soul-searching the brewery was increased in size to 15 bbl and room to grow to 10,000 bbls production per year. By October 2011, we started to formulate the first recipes.

name: American Vintage Beverage Inc
description: At American Vintage Beverage Co., brewing great tasting teas is an art and a passion. We start with a blend of American and imported teas, and slow steep them to release and blend the flavors right in the kettle.

name: Ancient Lakes Brewing Company
description:
Ancient Lakes Brewing Company where we are passionate about making beer and work hard to brew beers that look good, smell good and taste good! Ours is a very small manufacturing brewery located in Grant County, just north and west of Quincy, Washington. Founded in August, 2010 by three families from the Quincy area, the Ancient Lakes Brewing Company currently has one brewer.

Our 2/3 barrel brewhouse produces small batches of beer that take about three weeks from brew-day to packaging-day. We hand-fill our Cornelius and 1/6 bbl kegs and hand-bottle/hand-pack each case of 22 ounce bottles.

name: Andean Brewing Company, Inc.
description: Imagine a place where ancient knowledge meets modern concepts, where tradition meets the distinct, a place where two elements fuse as one, a place so exhilarating it escapes the imagination. This union is only possible because of the long-standing tradition of the Andean people committing themselves to the Pachamama - Mother Earth.

name: Armadillo Ale Works
description: Our mission is to give Denton, TX fresh, handcrafted beers that are as unique as it is. We believe that bigger is not necessarily better, and good things come in small packages: like babies, puppies, and kittens. We believe our beer should be no different. By staying small, we’ll be able to devote the time, care, and love to each beer.

name: Arvada Beer Company
description:
Arvada Beer Company is located in Olde Town Arvada, CO. Arvada Beer Company is the first Micro Brewery in the city of Arvada.

Arvada Beer Company is considered a “micro-brewery”, which produces beer that is wholesaled to pubs, taverns and restaurants in the city of Arvada, throughout Jefferson County, and  to the broader regional market.

Our tasting room allows you to view the operation of the brewery, purchase beer by the glass, growlers and kegs of beer to go, and retail items such as T-shirts and glassware with our logo.

Arvada Beer Company is different than most microbreweries due to our large tasting room. We have approximately 150 seats.

We have 14 taps that allow us to have specialty beers as well as our flagship beers on tap at all times.

Arvada Beer Company produces beer with a 7-barrel, stainless steel brewing plant.

name: Ashtown Brewing Company
description:
Ashtown was conceptualized on a cold morning around a homebrewing setup in Longview Washington by two cousins who found themselves on a map in between two craft beer meccas and knew something needed to change to bring good beer to a vacant area.

In September of 2013 Ashtown opened their doors bringing local hand crafted ales to Southwest Washington. Ashtown believes in its community and the change it can make on a local level.

name: Ass Kisser Ales
description:
Ass Kisser Beverage Company is based in Fort Worth, Texas. We are a family owned company from South Australia. It is operated by Rocland Wine Imports. The Ales are brewed at our brewery in San Jose, CA. 

The Line includes a Double IPA, Smoked Porter, Vanilla Pale Ale, Hefewiezen and a Strawberry Wit. 

Ass Kisser Ales is a state of mind. Just as you contemplate the flavors and aromas of this fine ale, you can comtemplate sharing it with your friend or your boss. Maybe they are one in the same or maybe not! We are Just Sayin!

name: Australian Brewery
description:
Established in July 2010, the Australian Brewery has become an iconic venue in the community providing locals and tourists with a family friendly food, entertainment and sporting precinct second to none. Hand crafted beer; fresh pure Australian produce, a warm atmosphere, state-of-the-art sporting facilities and uniquely designed true blue decor make this hotel a destination in itself.
The Australian Brewery caters for everyone especially the little ones. A dedicated glass enclosed kid’s dining room catering for up to 80 along with an all-weather adventure playground, kid’s activities, parents change facilities and tasty kiddies corner menu are just some of the reasons why families from all over Sydney are drawn to the hotel daily. If that’s not enough to attract families, this family friendly hub also offers free face painting on Sundays with a family bistro featuring indoor and alfresco dining.
From the Comfy leather armchairs in the TAB to the Dragon tree in the Beer Garden, the hotel makes you feel right at home as soon as you step in the front door. We look forward to seeing you in the Hotel soon and enjoying The Australian Hotel and Brewery experience.
Home of live sports in the Hill's.

name: Bad Ass Brewery
description: My name is Matt I have been home brewing for 23 plus years.  A friend of mine Allen O’Brien introduced me to “real” beer when I tried to offer him a Keystone.  I’ve been hooked on making and drinking real beer ever since.  My wife enrolled me in a home brewing class in Durango Colorado.  Over the past 23 years I have only made three bad beers out of thousands of batches.  I ended 26 years of the construction trades February of 2010 to fulfill my dream of opening a micro brewery.  Welcome to BAB short for Bad Ass Brewery.  My beers are hand crafted personal recipes sometimes extreme gravity.  I invite you to come on out and sample some of my latest creations.  No less than 20 beers on tap from Girly Pale, fruited beers to award winning stouts and over the top barley wines.

name: Bad Attitude Craft Beer
description: Bad Attitude is a Swift Craft beer brewed in Stabio since 2010.

name: Bad Tom Brewing
description:
On June 28, 1895, after confessing to the murder of six people, “Bad Tom” Smith uttered his final words before meeting a hangman’s noose in Breathitt County, Ky.: “Bad women and bad whiskey have brought me where I am. I give you this warning: Don’t drink bad whiskey and don’t do as I have done.”

While he doesn’t think highly of his great-great uncle, Sean Smith, Bad Tom co-owner, has turned his relative’s evil deeds into a namesake for a local brewery. “My penance is to make good beer for all the bad whiskey he drank,” Smith quips.

After talking and sharing his great-great uncle’s story with Charles Boucher, co-owner and master brewer, they decided to change the name to Bad Tom Smith Brewing.

Boucher’s beer list includes the flagship Bad Tom Smith, a reddish brown ale. Other favorites are Brother Clement, a white Belgian ale brewed with more than a 100 pounds of clementines, and Old Abe American Ale, an American-style ale based on English beers with a dark amber color.

name: Badlands Brewery
description: Come and try all Badlands Beers on tap. Enjoy fantastic homecooked breakfasts, lunches and cakes using fresh local produce where possible and browse the store stocking a wide range of interesting and tasty local produce including one of Orange's best selection of local wines.

name: Baldy Beard Brewing Company
description:
Baldy Beard is the founder and creator of the brewery which bares his name. He is rarely seen, but heard from often. Drink With Friends.

Baldy Beard Brewing Company is a nanobrewery with a 1.5 barrel system.
Our brewery is currently under construction, but there will be plenty of time soon to #DrinkWithFriends.

name: Balmain Brewing Company
description:
The Balmain Brewing Company was launched in 2010 in honour of tradition, mates and pub culture. The Company is owned by a group of passionate mates, locals to Balmain, with the following vision:
• Becoming Sydney’s own iconic local beer company, representing tradition, mates and pub culture
• Brewing hand-crafted quality beer
• Having the majority of pubs in Sydney pouring a Balmain Brewing Company beer
• Re-opening the old Balmain Brewery of the 1980’s as a Microbrewery/Restaurant.

The mates dreamed up the plan while drinking over the years in each of Balmain’s 17 pubs, and hearing about the Balmain Brewery of last century and the 55 pubs of the 1800’s! Over the last couple of years several beers have been launched – Balmain Pale Ale, Balmain Pilsner and Balmain Bock, as well as the recent launch of the Balmain Apple Cider. 2012 will see the introduction of a wider range of bottled beer and the planned opening of the Balmain Microbrewery/Restaurant.

name: Banff Ave Brewing Compay
description:
Our founding principle at the Banff Ave Brewing Company is to create the absolute highest quality beer possible. This guiding philosophy encompasses everything that we do. We use only the best: premium hops and malts combined with our own cultured yeast strains. Our fourth and final ingredient is the pure, natural mountain water sourced from the great Canadian Rockies. Unlike most commercial breweries, we do nothing to our water but remove the chlorine added to it. Our fresh beer is made with real glacial water and all the minerals that come with it!

The premium beers that we brew have grown from roots grounded deeply in tradition. Our dedicated Brewmaster uses time-tested recipes and brewing methods in our traditional, English-style brewery. Our hops and malts are sourced from around the world as to provide true styles with the unique twist of glacial water. This combination yields beers that are absolutely the best that they can be.

Our beers are for everyone. They are fresh, modern, and innovatively looking to the future. They are true and honest, drawing on experience from the past. We truly believe there is an occasion for every beer and a beer for every occasion.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 2:00 am

name: Baranof Island Brewing Company
description:
Baranof Island Brewing Co. is owned, operated, sampled and sold by Sitkan beer lovers, Rick and Suzan. When they opened the brewery in 2010, enthusiastic townspeople drank up the supply so quickly, they immediately had to ramp up the capacity of their operations.
Now that they can keep the thirsty locals satisfied (look for BIBCo. on tap at local restaurants), they are ready to share with you their passion for really good hand-crafted beer.

Brew nerds will appreciate that every unfiltered 55-gallon batch is a combination of pure, glacier-fed Alaskan water and a blend of gourmet malts and hops, lovingly selected by master brewer, Sam.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Barhop Brewing
description: Barhop Brewing: Like many native Californians, Tom struggled with the all the rain in the northwest until he figured out what to do with it: start fermenting it! And so Barhop Brewing was born. On brew days, you can hear Tom brewing to the tunes of Pearl Jam, Bob Marley, The Grateful Dead, Led Zepplin, and so on. Tom’s California beer-drinking youth provided him with a strong affinity for the pioneers of micro-brewing, back when Sierra Nevada, Pete’s Wicked, and Mendocino Brewing were small craft brewers. Decades of drinking beer – and specifically micro-brews – have contributed to Tom’s brewing pedigree. (Or so he says.) Currently he is a big fan of Elysian and Russian River Brewing, and these companies have influenced his brewing style which he calls “aggressive California-style ales, with a Northwest twist, using fresh Northwest ingredients”.

name: Barley and Vine Brewery
description:
Since 2003, family and friends have come to know that initials on the bottle caps along with names of classic cars designate beers from the Barley and Vine Brewery.   Barley and Vine is becoming known for great quality ales, and at times going to extremes to provide the very best in beer.

From the first batch of beer, Rambler Red, brewing was destined for the garage or outdoors because of the huge mess and bad smell made in the kitchen. So, for the first four years Barley and Vine was making 5-gallon extract batches.  Barley and Vine began sharing the beers with friends and family looking for input and making corrections and changes when needed.  As time went by the brewing skill level and quality of the beer continued to improve.   Changing from 5-gallon extract batched to 10 gallon all-grain batches made a huge difference in the quality of the final product.

Barley and Vine is a nano brewery in the planning.  As we continue to build our business plan, determine a location, and perfect our recipes and processes we will do our best to keep people up to speed through this website, Facebook, and our blog.  The ultimate dream is to have a brewery and a brewpub.

name: Barrage Brewing Company
description:
Barrage Brewing Company is a 1 BBL capacity Brewery, but soon to become a 3 BBL Brewery. The Brewery was Started in 2010 with it's roots in Nassau County. Distribution will only be through out the Long Island and Manhattan areas. 

Quality Brewed Craft Beers for the common person as well as the Beer Connoisseur.

name: Baxter Brewing Company
description:
Baxter Brewing Company is the first craft brewery in New England to can its entire line of beers. Located in the historic Bates Mill in Lewiston, Maine, Baxter beers are currently distributed throughout the state of Maine.

Founded by company President & CEO Luke Livingston (who is joined by Director of Brewing Operations/Head Brewer Michael LaCharite), Baxter Brewing Co., LLC is the first craft brewery in New England to can its entire line of beers. Located in the historic Bates Mill in Lewiston, Maine, Baxter beers are currently distributed throughout the state of Maine and are expected across the rest of northern New England in the summer of 2011. For more information, please visit www.baxterbrewing.com.

name: Baying Hound Aleworks
description:
Baying Hound Aleworks is a small independent nano-brewery in Rockville, Maryland. The brewery produces small batch beers and uses only the highest quality ingredients.

Our beers are unpasteurized and contain no additives or preservatives. Instead of forcing carbonation, Baying Hound ales undergo a secondary fermentation and are conditioned under a controlled environment.

name: Beach Brewing Company
description: We are a craft brewery, located in sunny Virginia Beach, Virginia. When we say 'craft', we don't just mean small; we mean our beer is made with great care, using only the purest ingredients and smartest techniques. We don't just aim to create beers that satisfy, but rather to craft brews that inspire. We love what we do and that passion is inherent in every ounce of what flows out of our brewhouse.

name: Beaver View Brew Co
description: Each Beaver View Brew is small-batch handcrafted within a stone's throw of the mighty Beaver Creek. We're really just a couple guys who like to make (and drink) good beer. We use an all-grain method, hand-grinding select grains fresh for each brew.

name: Bellevue Brewing Company
description:
Bellevue's first production brewery specializing in small-batch, handcrafted ales and lagers! We will be utilizing a 20BBL brewhouse with 160BBLs of fermentation capacity.

Although we don't intend to be an organic brewery, we will use organic ingredients whenever possible and, once food service begins, our menu items will feature organic ingredients as well. A children's menu will also be offered.

Our goal is to showcase the wonderful flavors of Washington with local food and brewing ingredients...keeping it local is good business!

We'll also feature a new Washington State wine each month and provide two guest taps for our craft brewing colleagues to showcase their beers.

name: Bent Paddle Brewing Co.
description: Bent Paddle Brewing Co.® will be a production craft brewery located in Duluth, Minnesota. Our 30-barrel brewery and Duluth’s first production brewery taproom, The Bent Tap, is expected to open in Winter / Spring 2013. We are excited to use the amazing water of Lake Superior along with the talent of our brewers to make some of the freshest, tastiest and most dependable craft beer possible.

name: Bier Brewery & Taproom
description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.

name: Biltmore Brewing Company
description:
When something is truly exceptional it earns your loyalty. That’s why we named our beer after George Vanderbilt’s beloved St. Bernard, Cedric. Family photographs capture moments of Cedric enjoying sunshine on the Loggia and sneaking in quiet naps in the library. Wherever George was, Cedric was sure to follow. That’s the kind of loyalty that inspires us to craft a quality beer—a beer worth your loyalty.

In fact, we’d been thinking of creating a line of Biltmore beers bearing Cedric’s name for many years. Then, when the decision was made to open a tavern on the estate, aptly named Cedric’s Tavern, as part of the new Antler Hill Village, the opportunity presented itself to turn the idea of producing a line of beer into reality. That’s how Biltmore Brewing Company was established.

Each beer in Cedric’s line is crafted to the exacting standards that George Vanderbilt appreciated and is made in the traditional English style. Craft beer enthusiast and newly appointed manager of Cedric’s Tavern, Bryan McIntosh has led the style selection of these new brews.

name: Birrificio del Forte
description: The Adventure of the Fort Brewery was founded in 2010 as "obligatory" stop of a journey undertaken several years ago. The strong passion for craft beer has made known, wowed us and filled our lives more and more, up to actively involve us as organizers of major events and competitions at local and national level. Over the years, our experience and knowledge of the field is increased up to us to develop the skills necessary to give life to our project: a craft brewer in Versilia.

name: Black Acre Brewing Company
description:
Black Acre Brewing Co. is a new small batch brewery located in Irvington, Indiana. The idea for Black Acre initially was conceived in 2010 due to our love of brewing, great beer, and the beer community at large. We created Black Acre with the goal of contributing delicious and unique beers to the community in which we live.

Black Acre hand crafts its ales using a custom fabricated 3 barrel electric brewing system. The brewery will produce four house beers along with an ever rotating selection of seasonal and specialty beers. Distribution will be primarily though in house tap room sales although there will be limited outside distribution. Our beers are not ready quite yet, but stop by for a glass of one of our delicious guest taps and meet the staff.

name: Black Couch Brewery
description: The concept for Black Couch Brewery was developed in late 2008 by three close friends, William Cook, Travis Morgan, and Dave Svec. After sampling one of the earliest batches of our flagship product, American Homecoming Pale Ale, we realized very quickly that it tasted better than even the most popular beer brands available in the regional marketplace. We were sure that others would enjoy our beer, and the positive responses from tasters everywhere have reinforced our belief in the quality and taste. We are committed to developing unique and flavorful beers, using the finest ingredients available. We are currently in the planning stages of the brewery and hope to have it up and running in the Washington D.C. area in late 2010 or early 2011.

name: Black Squirrel Brewing Company, LLC
description: The idea and the name were first thought of back in 2007 and incorporated in 2010. Dominating Beer and Coffee Since Yesterday!

name: Blatant Brewery
description:
Blatant beers are exceptional. That much is clear from the taste alone. 
Here’s what makes us world class:

Blatant beers are forceful, but never forced. 
These beers are dynamic and creative. 
We work with the brew on its own terms, nurturing and developing its unique personality. 
Anybody can throw together an average brew. 
Only a true artisan can craft a flavorful and vibrant drinking experience. 
No shortcuts. We pay extra attention to what goes in. 
We smell, taste and study each of our choice ingredients. 
Our brews are born of passion. 
Obviously, a love of brewing is the first ingredient in a brew worth loving. 

Blatant is new. We aren’t. 
We have been in the brewing business for many years—this experience, time and energy spent has earned us a reputation as talented brewers and true artisans. 

Yes, our beers are handcrafted. 
Yes, we are brew artisans. 
And yes, we've got well over 20 years experience in every keg, bottle, and can. But let’s face it: In the end, all that matters is the taste. 

Be Blatant!

name: Blue Pants Brewery
description:
Blue Pants Brewery was born out of a love of craft beer and craft beer culture. This first brewery is meant to be a gateway to the second and an inspiration to other small brewers that it can be done on this scale with a healthy amount of hard work. We’ve already had phone calls and emails from other brewers who are planning to follow in our footsteps, and we provide any help that we can. 

The Brewery will consist of a 1.5 Barrel (or about 45 gallon) brewing system. Initially, distribution will be in 1/4 Barrel kegs to bars around the area, draft only. All the beer will be keg conditioned prior to distribution to ensure that it is at its maximum freshness, finishing the fermentation the moment it is loaded on a refridgerated truck out of the brewery.

name: Blue Republic Brewing
description:
Blue Republic Brewing Company is a production brewery located in Shelby County, Indiana.

The brewery is currently in 'start-up' mode, but hopes to be operational in the near future. You can follow our progress here as we take the long journey to that first drop of pure deliciousness. And you know it will be something hoppy!!!

name: Bolero Snort Brewery
description: We are one of NJ's latest upstart craft breweries. In order to get "No BS...Just Ragin' Good Beer" into your glasses sooner rather than later, we will be contract brewing our beers to start with a full production site planned to open in late 2013.

name: Boneyard Beer Company
description:
Boneyard beer was started with one goal in mind Make a great beer! The major hurdle to overcome, however, was how to do so in large quantities without large sums of money. 

The solution was simple - you pull from the boneyard.

Head brewer and co-owner, tony lawrence has been brewing for other major breweries for over 20 years. Additionally he is the owner and president of brewtal ind. A brewery construction and consulting firm.

Every brewery has a "boneyard" of old brewing equipment where old/unused equipment go to rust. Tony along with co-owners clay and melodee storey, opted to revive the equipment and thus...

Boneyard beer was born!

name: Bonfire Brewing
description: Based in one of the coolest mountain towns of Colorado, Eagle, Bonfire Brewing makes beer (by "coolest" we mean, "neat," "nifty," and/or "fantabulous," not cold. It's actually fairly warm for the most part). We wouldn't describe our beer as face-meltingly good, maybe just face-warmingly delicious. It certainly encourages the use of non-existent adverbs. We started making beer because we needed more friends. Now our friends need more beer. So it goes.

name: Bosque Brewing
description: Bosque Brewing Co. has a very simple core value system. Brew beer with flavor and craftsmanship... Three home brewers with an affinity for crafting quality ales and crazy enough to wade into the business of their passion.

name: BottleTree Beer Co
description:
We at BottleTree Beer Company think it is a shame to see traditions being wiped from the Southern landscape and want to do our part to revive folk art and customs. Our goal is to bring quality beers to the Southeast, and help do our part to recognize beer as a quality product worthy of being served in the finest establishments, and enjoyed by everyone.

We are committed to bringing the Southeast, the highest quality world-class beers, using the finest ingredients, a whole lot of imagination, and of course doing our part to help rid the world of evil.

name: Boxcar Brewing Company
description:
Boxcar Brewing Company is a community-oriented brewing company providing fine crafted beer to be enjoyed with family and friends.
The idea for Box Car Brewing Company originated in 2006 in Tennessee at the wedding of two of its chief members Jason and Kristen Kohser. In the mountains of Tennessee gathered a very small group of friends and family including Jason’s cousin Kymberly and her then boyfriend Jamie Robinson. After an intimate ceremony, the entire group enjoyed a reception complete with homemade guacamole and a tub full of crudely marked “homebrews” prepared by Jason. Prior to this, he had been working in high-end restaurants as a general manager, bartender and food server for over 20 years. He spent several years in Northern California learning the fine art of winemaking at a local winery in Sonoma. During this time Jason realized the beauty of brewing beer and his desire to share his creation(s) with others. He’s been brewing out of his kitchen sink for several years now, slowly perfecting his recipes, offering to teach others the art, and, most importantly, making and drinking some real good beer. Jamie, who has yet to find a brew he will not try, immediately was interested in Jason’s creations and quickly started picking his brain on the processes and formalities for creating these “homebrews”. While sucking down a few well-crafted brews in the hot sun, Jamie and Jason talked about their love of beer and the groundwork was laid.

A few months later, Jamie received a phone call from Jason, who had been mulling over the possibility of moving forward with the beer making, he then proposed the idea of moving to Pennsylvania. Jason asked if Jamie would be interested in working together and the dream of opening a brewery was declared. In 2007, Jason and his wife moved to West Chester, PA where many of his family live. Together with the other three members the idea was hatched to get serious and start brewing beer on a larger scale, for the beer lovers in Chester County, PA. Box Car Brewing Company became a reality.

name: Brainerd Lakes Beer
description: Brainerd Lakes Beer. Giving you a taste of the laidback lifestyle found only in Minnesota's lake country. It has long been said that a beer is only as good as the place it was born. (Okay, so we made that up...but that doesn't make it any less true.) So we (and by we, we mean a couple of local guys) set out to create a Minnesota beer that embodies the laidback lifestyle of one of the greatest places on earth. We want this page to be all about you. We welcome your input, thoughts, feelings, tips on fishing hotspots...whatever you feel inclined to share and discuss. Talk to us about beer, Minnesota beer, Brainerd beer, beer making, beer brewing, IPA, wheat beer, lager, stout (can you tell we like to talk shop?) or anything else that comes to mind.

name: Brasserie artisanale Albion
description:
Albion is the history of England and poetic name, but it is also a brewery 100% Lanaudière. At Albion, so these are beers brewed on the premises of British inspiration that are available, all in a warm and relaxed atmosphere. Know that great care is taken as the service that brewing our beers. We have license artisan brewer, which mean that our beers are only available at our facility.

With our special prices to 5-7, our summer terrace and the unique atmosphere of the place, the Albion is the perfect place to come and drink a beer in Joliette!

They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.

name: Brewery Vivant
description:
Brewery Vivant is the realization of years of dreaming and much discussion of what a great brewery can be. What makes our brewery different from the rest is the way we approach our craft and operate our business. The core of Brewery Vivant can be found at the crossroads of three passions:

1. Our love of the tradition and artistic approach of the Belgian & French styles of beers

2. Devotion to using local sources for ingredients and running our business according to the three pillars of sustainability; Environmental Integrity, Social Equity, and Economic Viability

3. Sharing the experience of how beer and food can be paired to uplift the enjoyment of both

name: Bridge Brew Works
description:
Ken Linch and Nathan Herrold founded Bridge Brew Works to bring quality craft brewed beer to restaurants and pubs in West Virginia and beyond. They have 32 years of combined experience in home and commercial brewing and enjoy creating full flavored beers that honor tradition.

We have a goal to make a lasting connection with everyone in West Virginia who enjoys craft brewed beer.

name: Broad Brook Brewing
description:
Founded in September 2010, Broad Brook Brewing is a new micro-brewery located in East Windsr, Connecticut. By hand crafting our beer, using the finest ingredients available, we produce well balanced, high quality ales with a focus on drinkability.

Along with our award-winning lineup, we continue to develop new recipes on our 15 barrel system.

name: Burnside Brewing Co
description: Burnside Brewing Co is a production brewery & pub located in the central East side of Portland. Founded in 2010 Burnside is a creation of years of experience in the fermented beverage arts. Look for Burnside Brews to be available around Portland in early 2011 at your favorite beerstablishment or at our rustic pub. We're bringing Brewing back to Burnside!

name: Burnt Hickory Brewery
description:
Small package brewery located in NW Atlanta. We are in the development stages. Building recipes, working on brands... and getting out there with a deliverable "hype".  Brewing is a great craft. We love doing it... coming up with the best beers. Lovers of craft beer for over 25 years, We know good beer when we see feel and taste it. Taking that philosophy into mind when designing recipes, brewing beer,picking styles and brands, We are very proud of what we are doing.

We believe in a regional base with a national eye. Our brewery is named for a road that goes right thru the nearby Kennesaw Mountain Civil War battlefield. Head of the BHB, Scott Hedeen, was a mass comm major at Towson State in MD with a history minor. Lover of the Civil War, Scott decided to come up with beers with stories. Stories not based on "who was who's" side... but more of the drama,the guts and the lifestyle of the soldiers on both sides. Not to make someone feel as though they are getting whopped over the head with history and facts... the beers...such as "Old Wooden Head" (our Imperial IPA... named for Confederate General John Bell Hood...who was a principal player in the battle.. and nicknamed that by this troops for his tenacity)... are made more for the spirit and the feel of the time...mixed with a modern cool feel.

name: Butcher's Brewing Company
description: Butcher's Brewing™, located in Barrio Logan near the Padres ballpark and trendy East Village, is scheduled to open in September, 2010. We are focused on our own unique interpretation of historical styles as well as creating innovative new styles such as our Hawaiian Style Pale Ale. Butcher's™ beer will be available locally through regional distribution and internationally in Japan, and will also develop proprietary brands for SoCal based restaurants and pubs. As an independent local brewer we are committed to innovation, involvement with our community and the integrity and independence of our products.

name: Caution Brewing Company
description: Closest microbrewery to DIA, CAUTION is Denver's premier speciality brewery. Hand crafted, unusually balanced beers are made with amazing and local ingredients. Isn't it time you stopped by?

name: Cedar Creek Brewery
description: Cedar Creek Brewery started as an idea in October 2010 and has become a reality in 2012. Session beers are our passion and we really want that to be the focus of the brewery. Don’t get us wrong we really love those huge hop and malt bombs and will be releasing them as part of our seasonal and specialty lineup but having a few while enjoying the company of friends is the way we love to drink beer. So keeping our beers drinkable and with enough creativity that you want to keep coming back for more is our goal.

name: Chameleon Brewing
description:
With the start of a new decade, beer lovers are demanding something new. Not another new flavor of a mass-produced, foreign-owned beer, but something local that is new and exciting. That is why Chameleon Brewing is here.

Chameleon was founded by Randy Sprecher of Sprecher Brewing, a local company that Milwaukeeans have grown to know and love for 25 years. Just like Sprecher, Chameleon Brewing supports the local economy and recognizes that innovative American brewing styles are now setting the bar in the international beer world. Chameleon is a company focused on taking brewing to the next level by producing beers that are guaranteed to impress the savviest critic, yet also appealing to a widely diverse group of beer drinkers. Our brews are light bodied and refreshing, complimented by a fine balance of complex flavors and aromas.

Staying true to this principle, Chameleon would like to introduce its flagship beer – Hop On Top extra-pale ale. This aromatic non-bitter brew features a complex bouquet of dried flowers and hops. Easy to drink, Hop on Top has a toasty pale malt finish.

name: Chattanooga Brewing Company
description: Chattanooga Brewing Company opened in 1890 and lasted until 1915 and was the choice of beer drinkers in Chattanooga, selling beer in most of the local taverns and in cases of bottles. Among their brands of the day were Imperial Pilsner and Magnolia. Returning to the local beer scene in 2010, they have brought back Imperial Pilsner and many other tasty brews. Many German, English, and American styles are featured throughout the year.

name: Cismontane Brewing
description:
Cismontane Brewing Co. was started by two native southern Californians, Ross Stewart and Evan Weinberg. They chose the name Cismontane because the geographical area it represents, coastal Southern California from Santa Barbara to San Diego. As a brewery we are dedicated to creating the finest beers to represent the unique culture and diverse natural aspects of this region. Each beer is named after a local feature that is unique to the area.

The Brewery is located on the side of the largest mountain in Orange County in the city of Rancho Santa Margarita. The great views from Santiago peak and the trails through the canyons provide some of the natural inspiration for the beers and the company.

The brewery is small and accessible to all with a warm and comfortable tasting area. So don’t hesitate to come by when in the area.

(cis-mon-tane)

“This side of the mountains”, in reference to coastal Southern California. This was a common term used for Southern California while it was forming its identity during the gold rush and before prohibition.

Their love of beer and the brewing process is the impetus for the Coalator Program, which encourages local home brewers to brew their recipes in the brewery and serve them at the pub.

Coalition Brewing prides itself on highly balanced, drinkable beers.

name: Cosmic Frog Handcrafted Ales
description:
Nanobrewery in Buffalo NY currently in the licensing phase of start up. We look forward to serving handcrafted ales that we feel are both creative and a solid contribution to the craft beer renaissance. 

To enhance the culture of craft beer and quality of life of our community and customers by providing handcrafted, artisan ales created with thought, passion and attention to detail provided in an atmosphere that aspires to create mutual engagement.

name: Covington Brewhouse
description: Covington Brewhouse introduced a new craft brewing tradition to Louisiana in 2010 with the goal of showcasing local flavors and stories. Tours and tastings available to the general public weekly.

name: Crazy Mountain Brewing
description: Crazy Mountain Brewing Company was founded in January 2010 by Kevin and Marisa Selvy in the heart of the Rocky Mountains.  After a chance meeting in the Anchor Brewing Tasting Room, Kevin and Marisa decided to follow their crazy dreams and move to Colorado, Kevin's home state, and brew.  With a combined passion for craft beer, Kevin and Marisa founded the Vail Valley’s first production brewery.  Crazy Mountain was built with love from the ground up in a gutted warehouse, shipping in tanks and equipment from around the globe. Their first beer was poured at a beer festival in Vail in January 2010.  Using the highest quality ingredients, Crazy Mountain handcrafts each brew for beer enthusiasts across the United States, Japan, Hong Kong, and Sweden.  We say crazy is as crazy does, so drink up and live the life you want!

name: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project
description: Crooked Stave is a progressive, artisan brewery that strives to blend brewing science and art, through creativity and following our passion. We are based in Denver, Colorado while the unique beers we produce draw inspiration from worldly adventures. All our beers are produced from the highest quality ingredients, using contemporary and historic brewing techniques aimed at evolving ones perception of what beer is and focused on delivering the best possible drinking experience.

name: Crossroads Brewing Company
description:
If you could be doing whatever you want right now, what would you be doing? For Ken Landin and Janine Bennett the answer to that question would always be "listening to live music and drinking craft beer." Fueled by their outrage over the political and corporate disaster that unfolded on the nightly news, and frustrated by the thought that their lifestyle may contribute to the problem, they were at a crossroads. And so began the plan for Crossroads Brewing Company.
 
There was many years of discussion, research, paperwork, rejection, and searching for the perfect property.  After having deals fall through and the economy taking a turn for the worse, their hopes were fading. Then, in December of 2008, the Brooks Opera House in Historic Athens was discovered by accident. After leaving a restaurant just 2 miles from home they noticed a for sale sign on the deteriorating building and it's just like the old saying goes............when you know, you know.
 
It was quickly realized that when a community believes in what you are doing and puts it's support behind you, great things can happen. So they were off and running from the first turn of the key. Restoring a Historic Opera House from 1893 was not part of the original plan but with hard work and their secret weapon, Janine's brother Jimmy, things are coming together. Ken, Janine, Jimmy and Janine's Dad, Jim, have had their hands on just about every square inch of this 15,000 square foot building. Little by little, this grand and unique property will be restored to it's former glory.
  
Everyday seems to bring a new challenge but the ultimate goal remains clear. This building was once the hub of this sleepy riverside village and Ken and Janine intend to return it to the community. The second floor, where the Opera House once was, will get a new stage for plays and musical performances of all kinds. Athens is surrounded by hard working farmers so looking any further for meats and produce just doesn't make sense.  From organic menu items to earth friendly building materials the environment is a factor in every decision that is made along the way. They hope to eventually have the brewery running "off the grid" as well.
 
Ken, Janine, Brewer Hutch Kugeman and Chef Paul Parillo invite you to come visit the pub in Athens, NY.  There's 10 craft beers on tap and a menu that showcases the small farms of the Hudson Valley.   Cheers!

name: Crystal Springs Brewing Co

You have found something unique to pour into your favorite glass. Our brewery is named after the original Crystal Springs Brewing and Ice Company, founded in 1875 in Boulder, Colorado. We brew craft beer you must try. Each of our beers begin with a simple theme: to create memorable beers - ones that our customers will savor and want to share with close friends. Drinking great beer is our aspiration, making great beer is our passion.

description:
We started with a man and his dream. Our founder, Leigh loved sampling beers but felt that something was missing. After some encouragement from his friends, and a loving and understanding wife, he decided to start making his own. As it turned out, he was a natural Brewmaster. That was 3 years ago. 

Today, the brewery has grown from a single pot on a stove, to a three vessel BCS system and continues to expand. 

﻿At Double Dizzy we’re passionate about making beer and drinking beer!

name: Down Easy Brewing
description: There are few enemies on a porch swing, and there are no strangers in a bar. Slide up with a few friends because good beer goes Down Easy!

name: Draper Brewing
description:
Welcome to Draper Brewing. Draper started  in 2010 located in Tenmile, Oregon nestled between the wineries of the beautiful Umpqua Valley.

The original Draper brews were done on a one barrel system which has since been replaced by a 5 bbl system. All current brews are fermented in an open primary fermentor in old world tradition. All bottled beers are naturally carbonated by means of a secondary fermentation in the bottle. Every bottle is  sanitized, filled, capped and  packaged by hand.

name: Dungarvan Brewing
description:
Dungarvan Brewing Company was launched in April 2010 after a couple of years spent researching, planning and developing by the four founders.
The philosophy of the brewery is one of purity — we keep the beer in its purest form by bottle-conditioning it. It isn’t filtered, isn’t pasteurised and is naturally carbonated so there is minimum interference with it between raw ingredients and finished product. We always start with the best quality ingredients including; Maris Otter malt, full leaf hop cones and the limestone rich water of West Waterford.
Our brewer strives for quality and consistency across every stage of the brew, working hard to ensure that each bottle achieves the high standards he has set. All the beers are craft brewed in small batches and by its artisan nature this can lead to slight variations by batch.
The brewhouse is a 6bbl plant made by PBC Brewery Installations, the UK’s top micro brewery installer and is ideally suited to the bottle-conditioned traditional ales that we brew.
Bottling is currently done by hand with a four-head filler with plans to upgrade this to an automated system in the coming months.

name: Einstök Icelandic Craft Ale
description: It started with Bernard La Borie's search for the best water on the planet. He ultimately found it in the amazing country of Iceland, where abundant water is naturally filtered through ancient lava fields. In exploring ways to share this water with the rest of the world, we partnered with Vífilfell, a beverage bottler and distributor and one of the most respected companies in Iceland. They also happen to own the Viking Brewery in Akureyri - a fishing port located just 60 miles south of the... (read more)

name: Elk Valley Brewing Co.
description: Just a simple home brewer who is inspired to turn his passion into a career.

name: Eola Beer Company
description: Welcome to Eola Beer Company! We are located in the mountains of North Carolina in the beautiful and artistic city of Lenoir. Eola Beer Company features handcrafted artisanal beers made with local ingredients of the highest quality using malted barley, fresh whole cone hops, Appalachian Mountain waters and fresh cultured yeast. All Natural, Organic Beer with No additives, No extracts, and no shortcuts to provide you with the finest, freshest beer . We are also a Gastropub , Chef Stephen Loe uses local and seasonal ingredients to create an ever-changing menu of exciting , flavorful dishes from around the world. Influenced by many chefs, and culinary styles Loe focuses on Southern American, French, Cajun -Creole, and Indian. Stephen Loe has won many awards for his cooking and beers and is a graduate of the prestigious Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park NY. He has worked at many fine restaurants in New York , Emerils, Sonoma California Bistro, Barringtons, and Artisanal before starting his own. Eola is a great mountain destination with great food, great beer, souvenirs,gifts,live music and a fun , friendly atmosphere with outdoor seating in the historic downtown area. Please come make Eola your North Carolina Mountain tradition! Cheers

name: Equinox Brewing Company
description:
The most common question we get is, why Equinox Brewing? The equinox, and the intrigue of equal night and day, has deep roots in history and ritual. But, at the same time, the equinox marks the changing of the season, and forces us to look toward the future. We find it interesting that the two days out of the year that have perfect light and dark balance also show the balance between the past and the future, tradition and innovation. Beer contains similar elements. Sure, there’s the balance of flavors in a beer; sweet and bitter, rich and simple…

We find another aspect of beer’s balancing act fascinating. Historically, beer styles have developed because of limitations in local ingredients and the necessity to make do with what you have. However, due to global trade and modern shipping methods, limitations on ingredients have been removed. We can get any ingredients we want. While most modern brewers recognize the importance of beer styles and learn from the brewers who made them, they certainly don’t limit themselves to making beers that fit into traditional definitions.

On one level our beers fit into some traditional styles, but we put our own twist on them. We want our beers to capture elements from the past and incorporate new ideas, ingredients and techniques into them. We’re not afraid to try new things.

As a brewer, its playtime and work, balanced.

name: Evil Genius Beer Company
description: The Evil Genius Brewing Company is an Independent Craft Brewery located in Pennsylvania, owned by Luke Bowen, Trevor Hayward, and Mark Braunwarth. We are committed to making great beers which anyone can enjoy. Each beer is designed by Mark, our Master Brewer, using the highest quality ingredients and locally sourced water to ensure that you, our customer, will experience the same great taste over and over again. Our company is committed to supporting the local craft brewing movement in the tri-state region.

name: Fairport Brewing Company
description:
We're a small brewery providing hand-crafted beer in small batches. We sell our variety of beer in growlers from our brewery in Fairport, NY.

We're located in the business park at 1000 Turk Hill Road, right on the historic Erie Canal. After you enter the business park, drive past the buildings and park in the lot in the back. Walk back between the buildings, and look for Building 8 on the right. Use the “Classroom Entrance” and take the stairs or elevator on your left. You’ll find us on the second floor down the hall and to the right.

name: Feather Falls Casino Brewing Co
description:
In December 2010, Mooretown Rancheria unveiled this elegant addition to the area’s original gaming facility.  The décor features rich woods, plush fabrics and copper accents throughout the airy dining room.   

Visitors are taken with the view of gleaming brew tanks behind the bar, and the frequent sight of Brewmaster Roland Allen measuring ingredients and testing batches.  With seven craft beers and a rotating menu of seasonals, beer connoisseurs can always find a new taste on tap.

The 350-seat full service restaurant’s $1 million kitchen includes the only fresh sushi bar in the area.  Hand-crafted pizza with beer-infused crust is also available.  Diners enjoy an outdoor seating area with a custom shade lattice.  Food service extends to the balcony level, which boasts large leather chairs and a private bar.  Three luxury VIP suites are available to rent for group functions or private parties.

Entertainment is a major focus of the brewery, as well.   With a host of video poker machines and big-screen TVs, guests find plenty of activity to accompany the excellent food and drinks.  The dining room turns into a showroom at night, complete with live music on an elevated stage.  The state-of-the-art sound and light system enhance the concert experience.

Feather Falls Casino Brewing Company serves food and beverages 7 days a week, so make a point to visit the next time you’re in Northern California!

name: FireWheel Brewery Co.
description: FireWheel Brewing Co. (FWBC) is run by locals, born and raised in the North Dallas area. We brewed our inaugural homebrew in January of 2010. Originally starting as away to have great tasting beer to share with family and friends, the demand quickly outstripped the supply. We expanded our equipment to over double, then triple, and continued to keep all the fermenters full and active.

name: Flat Tail Brewing Co
description: Started in 2010 in Corvallis, OR, home of the Oregon State Beavers, Flat Tail Brewing started with a small 6 barrel system. 4 years later Brewer/Owner Dave Marliave is creating some of the best beers in Oregon.  From his flagship Tailgater Kölsch, an authentic German Style Ale, to his creative and eclectic barrel aged brews, this 25 year old wiz kid is taking Oregon by storm.  In Aug 2013, Flat Tail installed a brand new 15 barrel system and will be available all over Oregon and many more locations very soon.  Try some Dam Good Beer today!

name: Flat12 Bierwerks
description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

name: Florida Avenue Ales
description:
Brews that can be enjoyed rain or shine...from hot summer months to mild winters on the beach....
During hurricane season we bring the party...no matter what walk of life or Noreaster that brought you to the Sunshine State...once it hits your lips all you can think is: "Gotta Have A Florida Ave"©

name: Foggy Noggin Brewing
description: We are brewers of great English Styled Ales on a very small 1/2 BBL system. We are one of the world’s smallest production breweries. We take great pride in every batch to bring you consistent high quality brews year-round. You are able to get our fresh beers at our tasting room, located at our brewery in Bothell, WA and at several accounts that rotate our beers thru their line-up.

description: Foolproof Brewing Company in Pawtucket, Rhode Island, produces high-quality, hand-crafted beers. Each of our beers is designed with a specific experience in mind.

name: Forrest Brewing Company
description:
Forrest Brewing Company is equal parts microbrewery, eating place and mountain biking hang-out located in the Otways Hinterland township of Forrest.

Brother and sister duo Matt and Sharon Bradshaw resurrected and rebuilt the former general store in Forrest, opening its doors in late 2010. The Forrest Brewing Company embodies all of the things to love about life, great beer, informal eating, good people, mountain biking and some occassional fishing all surrounded by an active community and beautiful environment.

name: Founding Fathers Brewing Company
description:
Did you know that the best selling beers in America are produced by foreign-owned companies?

As Americans we believe the values and ideas that motivated our Founding Fathers are worth conserving.

By developing a brand name that is associated with these same principles and beliefs, Americans will be able to pave the direction of our great Country with the purchase of the New American beer, Founding Fathers Lager and Light.

50% of all profits will be donated back to the families of our troops. Better Beer, Better Cause.

When you see a Founding Fathers label in your local grocery or watering hole, you will associate it with the level of excellence that has made America the greatest Country in the World.

name: Fullsteam Brewery
description:
Fullsteam is a Durham, North Carolina brewery inspired by the agricultural and culinary traditions of the South.

Our mission is to craft a distinctly Southern beer style using local farmed goods, heirloom grains, and Southern botanicals. Like what, you wonder? We're making beer with sweet potatoes, corn grits, summer basil, and malted barley house-smoked over hickory. Other successful "plow to pint" experiments to-date include beer brewed with scuppernong grapes, persimmon, paw paw, rhubarb and more. 

Ultimately, our vision is to craft a year-round, sustainable, scalable, and distinctly Southern beer brewed 100% with local ingredients. That's the quest. We're a long ways from realizing this vision, but we hope you enjoy the adventure as much as we expect to. Interested? Read more about Southern-style beer.

name: Funky Buddha Lounge & Brewery
description:
Funky Buddha Brewery was founded in 2010 in Boca Raton, Florida, and is committed to producing bold craft beers that marry culinary-inspired ingredients with time-honored technique. Our mantra is big, bold flavors, made exactingly with natural ingredients. So, for example, if we say a beer will taste like peanut butter and jelly, you can be sure you’ll smell and taste the fresh roasted peanuts and fruity berry jam. Our flagship beers such as Hop Gun IPA and Floridian Hefeweizen, also strive towards big, bold flavor. It’s who we are.

Our Brewery is located in the heart of Oakland Park’s new Culinary Arts District. The 20,000 sq-ft facility is powered by a 30-barrel, three-piece brewhouse, which feeds nearly 1000 gallons of beer per batch into our four 60-barrel fermenters - a capacity that makes us South Florida’s largest craft microbrewery. Each of our distinctive beers is brewed using the finest, all-natural ingredients, then served up unpasteurized, unfiltered, and unfussed with. We offer tours of our 20,000 sq-ft facility, rotating food trucks nightly, and growlers of our brewery fresh beer to-go.

You can sample our creations in our spacious tap room - open 7 days a week, noon to midnight - as well as in bars and restaurants all across South Florida. And of course, we still brew at our original location in Boca Raton, the Funky Buddha Brewery & Lounge, which has become a test kitchen for our more experimental brews.

See you soon for a pint! Cheers!

name: GoodLife Brewing
description: Located on Bend's Westside. We take our name from the lifestyle that most Bend-ites live. With tons of recreation, sprinkled with hard work and friends make living in Bend truly the GoodLife. The 30 Barrel Brewhouse and fermentation area are the focal point of the huge viewing windows looking out from within the Bier Hall (our Tasting Room) where you can grab a pint of not only our delicious brew but some of our favorite breweries as well. With 5-7 rotating guest taps you’re sure to find a brew to make your GoodLife. Hope to see you for a pint soon ~ Cheers

name: Granite Mountain Brewing
description:
Granite Mountain Brewing is what happened when two couples - the Stangersons (Michael Stanger and Amanda Richardson) and the Swaffamotos (Damon Swafford and Audra Yamamoto) - got together (perhaps all-too-frequently) to enjoy good food and Michael's homebrew. Our shared love of food and beer propelled us to start an underground beer tasting movement during which we hosted a series of 7 beer tasting events over the course of a 13 months. We may be the new kids on the Prescott scene, but GMB brings ten years of brewing experience to the table. From the farmlands of Vermont to the mountains of Alaska; the homelands of Idaho and now the high deserts of Prescott! 

GMB opened the doors on the brewery and taproom in August 2012. By small operation, we mean SMALL. Not micro. We're talking about nanobrewing here, folks. We're a grassroots endeavor that began in a garage and garnered fast support from the community. 

We pride ourselves on high-quality unpretentious beer. We like to brew traditional styles as well as creative twists on the traditional. Inspired by the local landscape and community, we look forward to experimenting with local ingredients (wheat berries, juniper berries, prickly pear fruit) and becoming part of the local flavor of Prescott. Beer education is part of what we do: styles, processes, ingredients, and the magical pairing between beer and food. Why? Because this is all part of celebrating the simpler things in life: good food, good friends, good beer.

name: Haymarket Pub & Brewery
description: Specializing in classic Belgian and contemporary American beer styles, Pete will be producing an array of brews for every beer palette. Crowley, a highly decorated brewer has won over 50 local, national and international awards for his brewing creations including medals from the World Beer Cup, Great American Beer Festival and Festival of Wood and Barrel Aged Beer. Varieties will range from refreshing Pilsners to hoppy ales to rich Imperial Stouts aged in whiskey barrels in our own cellar, a brewing technique that has put Crowley on the national beer map for his pioneering work with the specialty. Our impressive array of 32 tap handles behind the bar will feature more than 10 house brewed varieties with space to offer other craft beer selections.

Quality brews of different styles ranging from the classic to the unconventional. We celebrate our love affair with beer and hope to share it with you. Herbert B. Friendly. Small town beer, made Friendly!

Started in 2010 as a brew club between two friends, Herbert B. Friendly Brewing went nano in August on 2012 and opened its doors for business in January of 2013. We’re a small family business looking to express ourselves creatively though beer and share it with our local community.

Come down to Carson City's only Brewery & Restaurant and indulge in our savory Deep Dish Pizzas while throwing back a pint of our OMG IPA or our Honey Ale! Don't forget to bring the Kidos! We have a kids menu with lots of goodies and hand crafted Root Beer and Orange Cream Soda.Get Brewed!

description: Hill Farmstead Brewery is the culmination of travel and insight, of friendships and explorations, and of realizing a sense of one’s place.  Upon the hand hewn land of our forebears, we honor eight generations of Greensboro ancestry by thoughtfully engaging with our heritage and with our distinctive beers. This offering is our effort to revive, diversify, and prolong the memory of the Hill Farmstead. Share. Consider. Enjoy.

name: Hogsback Brewing Company
description: New in 2010, the HogsBack Brewing Company is owned by four beer-loving Ottawa guys who strive to provide the finest-tasting beer using all-natural ingredients and traditional small batch brewing. Give us a try and let us know what you think!

name: Hogshead Brewery
description:
Hogshead Brewery and Tap Room has been designed and developed to provide a variety of beers with an emphasis on English ales in a warm and inviting atmosphere with a neighborhood friendly feel.

The Slo-Hi location was developed to allow a local clientele, as well as beer aficionados and lovers of good times a central spot in Denver to enjoy a proper pint and have a chat. We will always have three to four great beers on tap via CO2 pressurized kegs and plan to maintain properly conditioned Real Ale from naturally carbonated casks served from beer engines for those that enjoy this traditional British libation.

We are a Production Brewery and Tasting Room located in Leavenworth, Washington. We produce fresh, delicious craft brews!

Our tasting room overlooks our craft brewery where our head brewer, Dean Priebe has masterfully combined the pristine waters of the Icicle River with only the freshest ingredients to craft fresh and flavorful ales and lagers for your enjoyment.

name: Idle Hands Craft Ales
description: Based in Everett, Massachusetts, Idle Hands Craft Ales is the Boston area’s only nanobrewery.  We hand craft our beer with a nod towards belgian styles mixed with new world ideas. Founded in 2010, we recently received our federal license only days before the new year and are currently planning to produce our first commercial beers by late Winter/early Spring 2011.

name: Illawarra Brewing Company
description: Illawarra Brewing Company supplies 7 ongoing handcrafted beers and 2 rotating seasonal beers to bars, restaurants and cafes in Wollongong and the surrounding regions, and The Illawarra Brewery Bar on South Beach in Wollongong showcases all 9 brands. Illawarra Brewing Company also brews a number of beers on contract for some of the best craft breweries in NSW.

name: Indian Joe Brewing, Inc.
description: Welcome to Indian Joe Brewing. We are a taste experience pushing the boundaries of flavor and limitations on our beer. We brew a variety of handcrafted beverages such as Ales, Witbiers, Stouts and Hefeweizens. We are continuously changing our line up. So, stop on by and check us out!

name: Iron Fist Brewing Company
description: Iron Fist Brewing Company is a family owned brewery located in Vista, California, smack-dab in the middle of the exciting San Diego craft beer scene. Our passion for the best hand crafted beer prompted us to make a lot of it. However, we quickly realized we were making a bit more than we could drink ourselves, so we decided to sell whatever we don't drink to you. So do yourself a favor; start a little revolution. It's ok. We won't tell on you. Put the 500 pack of light lager back with all its buddies and rule your taste with an Iron Fist!

name: Jester King Craft Brewery
description: Located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country, Jester King Craft Brewery is an authentic farmhouse brewery committed to brewing artisan ales of great depth and character. At times drawing influences from the world beyond traditional brewers’ yeast, Jester King’s beer is not rushed to market but allowed to mature – often in oak barrels – to create the most enjoyable, interesting and exciting beer we can make. An additional layer of complexity is added to Jester King’s bottled beers by allowing a second fermentation to take place in the bottle. As part of its commitment to sustainability, the slow food movement and Texas, Jester King beer uses as many organic and local ingredients as possible and will soon be brewed with harvested rainwater.

name: Jurnee Brews
description: Jurnee Brewing Company (JBC) is a craft brewing partnership founded in 2010. Jurnee Brews has locations in Centreville, Virginia and Ewing, New Jersey.  This microbrewery is a collaboration of two men who themselves are on an exceptional journey to bring what was once an idea to your local watering hole. Jurnee is more than what is in the bottle, it's about how it came together...the journey. Just like in life, we have experiences throughout time that form who we are as people, it just so happens our journey culminates in a bottle.

name: La Cumbre Brewing Company
description:
La Cumbre Brewing Co. is what happens when two people take one thing altogether way too seriously. Beer is what we do. It’s all we do.
 
The best beer money can make; the best beer money can buy. Simple as that.
 
Sure, we could tell you about the quality ingredients, the state of the art equipment, the commitment to traditional brewing methods… But all you really need to know is that our brewer is the pickiest SOB on earth, especially when it comes to the beer he drinks.
 
Well, this is the beer he drinks.
 
And we guarantee that you won’t find better beer anywhere.

Established in 2004, Lagerheads has continued to reign supreme in finger-licking BBQ anywhere around! All of are meats are hickory smoked, and the finest BBQ sauce you'll ever have! All of which are hand-made on premises. Come join us in enjoying are famous ribs and wings, which were voted Best of the Best 2010 compliments of the Medina Gazette! 

New to 2010 is our brewery! Handcrafting lagers and ales, we have a taste to appease everyone. If you are really thirsty, we now offer growlers, 64oz of your favorite Lagerheads beer to take home, or to wherever the occasion brings you! We are brewing new beers often, so come in and enjoy us perfecting this art! (read less)

name: Lefty's Brewing Company
description: Lefty's Brewing Company is owned and operated by Bill “Lefty” Goldfarb in Bernardston, MA. This nano-brewery is a home brewer's dream come true. Bill, who has been a roofer by day and a home brewer by night for almost a decade, has finally decided to provide his popularly sought-after product to the public. He has traveled as far as Wisconsin to obtain equipment for his two barrel brewhouse. He is excited to finally put down the hammer and dedicate his full attention to commercially brewing his fine-tuned recipes. Bill, who firmly believes a local, family business offers the best service and product, is proud to have a family-run business operated by only him and his girlfriend. His product is hand-bottled and labeled. As of now, the beer is available in Franklin County, MA, with a wider distribution area in the future. Lefty creates high quality beers using only the finest quality ingredients available. He focuses on the simple pleasures of the traditional and time-tested European brewing techniques. Lefty looks forward to sharing 6 year-round beers, with seasonal and specialty batches offered throughout the year.

name: Lexington Avenue Brewery
description: Good times await in Asheville at the Lexington Avenue Brewery. Relax a while on our open air patio. Enjoy a craft beer and an incredible meal at the 92’ curving bar or a custom built dining table. Our historic downtown Asheville building provides the perfect atmosphere. The front stage regularly entertains LAB guests during dinner hours.

name: Loe's Brewing Company
description: Loe's Brewing Company  is a small craft brewery located in Hickory North Carolina. We specialize in handcrafted artisanal lagers and ales. We are one of the smallest breweries in North Carolina and also one of the smallest in the country. We have a 1.5 bbl brewhouse , 1 and 3 bbl fermentation tanks. Being so small we can afford to take more time and effort into our beers. We utilize many ingredients from all over the world, selecting only the finest grains, cultured yeast, fresh whole hops, and  our mountain water that is perfect for producing the best beers possible.  Another advantage of being small is that we can produce a wide variety of styles so our selection will always be changing. We will produce beers that fit the season and year round classics. Loe's Brewing takes pride in producing the finest handcrafted beers, and we are sure that once you try our beer you will agree that bigger is not always better , and will notice the difference that craft beer has to offer.  Cheers- The Loe's Brewing Team

name: Loowit Brewing Company
description: Established in 2012 by longtime Vancouver residents Devon Bray and Thomas Poffenroth, Loowit Brewing Company is the latest significant addition to underpin a revitalized downtown Vancouver, Washington. The company specializes in brewing small batch, hand crafted ales that are developed with a thoughtful approach balanced by a Pacific Northwest flair.

name: Low Brau
description:
Low Brau LLC is a Washington, DC based nano brewery created by Steven Sorrell in response to the current American Craftbrewing atmosphere. After visting breweries around the world, Steven noticed a lack of crisp refreshing session style beers brewed here in the US, so in 2010, the seeds of Low Brau were planted. 

With a background in the food industry and many years of beer research, it was only natural for Steven to start brewing at home, and wasn't long before he started creating his own recipes. Now a year later, Low Brau continues to move forward, with plans to open it's doors within the District in the next year. 

Low Brau's beers are German inspired, following the guidelines set fourth by the Rheinheitsgebot Purity Law and high quality ingredients. Each beer is hand crafted and brewed in small batches to maintain quality over quantity. 

Low Brau strongly believes in "Embracing Simplicity".

name: Lucette Brewing Company
description: Lucette is hand-crafted by guys and brought to life by the artistry of a woman. Don’t be offended or embarrassed by her voluptuous curves or stunning assets--she isn’t. Lucette is an image of revolution and evolution, much like experiencing a non-macro beer for the first time. And what’s more, she is created from the finest ingredients by the hands of our own brewers, at our own brewery, and not by some mysterious brewery far away from "home". In other words, she is not fake, diluted, or overproduced --she is 100% Lucette.

name: Lumberyard Brewing Company
description: Local Flagstaff brewpub and Micobrewery featuring award winning ales and lagers. Full menu with lots of sandwiches and BBQ. Great dance floor for late nite.

name: Mad Fox Brewing Company
description:
Mad Fox Brewing Company offers a dining experience unique to the Washington, DC, area: upscale casual dining in an English-style gastro brewpub with an emphasis on high-quality food to complement our house-brewed beers.

Mad Fox features a chef-driven, seasonal menu and frequent specials including pizza, panini, salads and vegetarian friendly foods; fresh, locally grown seasonal produce, cheeses and other ingredients; locally raised lamb, bison, beef, chicken and game; and house-cured meats.

Mad Fox has a 63-foot long bar showcasing our seven to ten standard, house-brewed beers on tap as well as a rotating selection of seasonal brews in German, English, Belgian and American styles. Also, don’t miss our cask conditioned proper Real Ales served through water jacketed Angram beer engines, ensuring that every pint is served at properly conditioned cellar temperatures.

name: Milkman Brewing
description:
Milkman Brewing is a collection of local home brewers that found each other and decided to combine forces to offer locally made artisan beer for Pittsburgh and the surrounding areas!

Our goal is to become a licensed boutique brewery so we can make specialty local beer for private and public events.

We love that Pittsburgh is a city full of thriving small businesses, fantastic local eateries, and beautiful art. It is our hope to someday be known as one of the things that makes our city unique and wonderful!

name: Millking It Productions
description: MillKing It Productions (a.k.a…MIP) was founded in 2010 with a singular mission: To strip down all pretensions and preconceived notions of the craft brewing industry and create a truly memorable and focused catalog of fine beers. MIP does not have a sampling room or bar. We brew a limited number of stylistically and historically accurate beers. We will not jump from marketing wave to wave. We will not brew unbalanced fad beers. We will never put fruit, vegetables or other gimmicks into our beer. Finally, all beers will be packaged in draft, cask and what we see as the most responsible and best individual container…Aluminum Cans.

name: Mimbres Valley Brewing Company
description: Our beers are all hand-crafted and have a unique personality to them that sets Mimbres Valley apart from other breweries. We use hops from all over the world and take great care in our selection of hops and grains.

The new Moon beers can be described as ‘German-fusion’ and are Brewmaster Clay’s West-coast interpretation of traditional German styles. All beers are 100% natural, unfiltered and naturally carbonated. Guest beers are handpicked to showcase some of the best Craft Beers in British Columbia and served alongside the house brewed beers.

name: Moonlight Meadery
description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.

name: Mornington Peninsula Brewery
description:
Our Symbol

Derived from a medieval alchemy sign for Aurum Potabile, drinkable gold. It was used as a rejuvenating medicine, an elixir of life. Paracelus, a famous alchemist once wrote: “…drinkable gold will cure all illnesses, it renews and restores”. While we know now that medieval medicine did get a few things wrong, the idea of drinking liquid gold is not a bad thought. Cheers!

name: Mother Earth Brewing Company
description: Mother Earth Brewing Company is located on the corner of Heritage and North Street in Kinston NC. The facility includes the brewery itself, a bottling facility and Mother Earth’s corporate offices. In keeping with our company name, our rehabilitation of this old building is incorporating green technology, eco-friendly building materials and alternative energy sources wherever possible. Future plans include opening a tap room and offering tours of the brewery. Mother Earth’s four staple beers are a Munich Dunkel, an American IPA (organic), a Belgian Wit and a Kolsch, along with seasonal brews and oak aged beers. Mother Earth will distribute statewide in groceries, restaurants, and bars. Look for Mother Earth products soon..

name: Nantahala Brewing Company
